revised_title: Turbulence and Boundary Layer: Theoretical Discussion on the Relationship between Turbulence Scale and Critical Resistance of Spheres
tldr: The authors propose a statistical theory of turbulence, focusing on its effect on boundary layers. They discuss the relationship between the scale of turbulence and the critical resistance of spheres, concluding that the critical Reynolds number depends on the ratio of the sphere's diameter to the scale of turbulence. The theory is supported by experimental observations.
